intro: Anthriscus kotschyi, commonly known as the desert cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-shaped flower clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its slender stems and finely divided leaves contribute to its distinctive appearance. Anthriscus kotschyi is often found in steppes and mountainous areas where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
